channel.title: My employer not allowing me to take holiday
channel.description:
Basically, I've paid for a ticket for a festival that is in 2 weeks. Last week, the my boss told me that because of short staffing I wont be able to take that weekend off, yet he allows another full-time guy there to take the time off. I've been working there for 2 fucking years every weekend, and they give some other new full time guy priority.
They said to me that if I do not turn up to work that weekend, they will fire me, so I'm trying to work out a plan so I can quit and get another job, but now I'm worried about not giving enough notice, so I wont be able to go anyway.
Are they allowed to refuse me to take a weekend off? If they are, are they allowed to fire me for not turning up to work/calling in sick without a doctors note?

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:16, topic:346501”]What kind of fuck-up country allows the employer to do such a thing? A contract is a contract, if it happened here, the union would rage massively hard + you could sue your boss.

That said, if you did work during a weekend here when you had a planned vacation, they’d be forced to pay at least 250% more for the “overtime”[/quote]

Who said he had a union? Plus, here, overtime is more than 8 hours a day or more than 40 hours a week, and you must be paid 1.5 times your normal wage. (so if you make $10/hour you must be paid $15/hour for overtime)

And there is no mandatory amount of vacation days a year or anything, the above laws are pretty much it. Who knows what they are in england though.

item.title: My employer not allowing me to take holiday
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Depends on the employer/boss/company. Maybe you can go up higher? Like corporate or something, or if you are very important to your boss just tell him a few days before that you won’t be in because they already told you you could have them off and you are going.

I worked at a meijer (like a walmart supercenter) from 16-20ish, and at slightly over 18 I requested off for a friday night about 6 months in advance for my high school graduation. When time got close, they told me I had to NOT go to my high school graduation and instead come into work for a 5 hour shift. I explained over and over that I’d worked there ever since I was legally able to so I could save money for college and graduate high school, and that I wasn’t going to miss it, they didn’t listen. So wednesday night I called and told them I wasn’t going to come in friday, I wasn’t going to call off, and if they wrote me up or fired me or anything I would take it to corporate, the union, local newspapers or whatever I had to do. I didn’t come in, and they never said another word about it. I guess I called their bluff.

So you could try the same, but be aware of the possible consequences.
